definitions.definition: To deprive of nerve, force, or strength; to weaken ; to enfeeble . Compare enervate .
To make somebody nervous, upset , alarm , shake the resolve of.
examples: I was greatly unnerved by the news that my attacker was back in the country.

main_definition: To deprive of nerve, force, or strength; to weaken ; to enfeeble . Compare enervate .
